Review: There are many things organized like DJ night, the annual night fest, in march month there is also a central library which is called Nalanda central library and also every department has its own library there are 2 lakhs above books there are also many games organized there is intramural games fest organized in January and interfacility games organized in march there are so many social groups like brotherhood, ABVP, NSUI, etc.

Name: Malvika
Heading: Life at KJ
Review: I was looking for this course for my post-graduation. There are back-to-back lectures as there is a block system. Hence every subject is taught for 10 days. The faculty is good enough. They have many visiting faculties who are currently working in big companies in higher positions. Their experience brings in a lot of industrial exposure. Adding to it, regular case study discussions take place in every subject.

Name: Rahul Buwade
Heading: This college providing us better
Review: After the end of 6th-semester students become eligible for a seat in campus placement and get a good salary package that they are offered to us. TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, Hexaware, and many more companies visit that college and they offered packages like 5-9 LPA. In that college all over 90-95% of students are placed every year.

Name: Atif Quamar
Heading: The college is awesome.
Review:
The facility of this college is very good.
There are 3 courses in this college LLB ( 3 YEAR LAW ), BA LLB ( 5 YEAR LAW ), and LLM ( 2 YEAR ).
The choose this course because I want to become a lawyer. 
The student ratio of this college is more than 1200.
Seat of LLB is 180 and BA LLB is 120 and LLM is 60.
All the teachers are well qualified. They all did phd from good institutions and give tests to teachers then they were selected.
We have no tension for exam because our teacher teach us very well and we are able to pass without self-study anymore because the class of college is awesome we understand everything that the teacher told us.

Name: Uddeshya
Heading: Poornima university
Review: I choose BBA for my family business. The faculty of the college is very nice and Frank to the students. You can easily share anything from the faculty. Most of the faculty have done phd and various degrees. The teaching method is very nice. The exam is conducted in a gap of 1.5 months and was not too hard to pass.

Name: J Keziah Gracelin
Heading: Nirmala College For Women - The best place
Review: In our college, generally, the cost of the study is very less. Still, we have all the government scholarships which many students avail. We also have special scholarships from the departments and the old students association. Some students get scholarships from private organisations also. Financial assistance is given by the college for all the needful students. Regarding the campus jobs, we have a separate placement cell with a faculty and student head under and we have a team leading it. We are given placement training through classes and mock interviews. We are well-trained to face all the interviews and we are encouraged to attend all the interviews. Every year we have many companies coming and recruiting our college students for various jobs. For this academic year, till now around 30 companies have come for recruitment and in all the companies a maximum number of students are placed. I have received merit and government scholarships and I'm placed in 4 companies till now.

Name: DHRUV BHARGAV
Heading: Read once before taking addmission in UIT
Review:
I'll choose my course of b tech in computer science and engineering because I have an interest in these subjects from my previous classes and I feel confident and good enough to choose this course as my career.
 We feel so blessed to have a very nice and very supportive faculty as they make sure to the students that they are in very knowledgeable hands hence as a student I feel that if in any situation of tasks, the faculty is always with me.
Mostly all our faculty members are post graduated and some of them are at the post of PHD. And about the teaching method, most of the faculty teach in a natural way and most of them teach us at a basic level.
In our college, exams are arranged in every three times, the first two are known as sessional 1 and 2 respectively and the last one the main (final) exam called finals. These are tough but easy to pass coz of the preparation for class tests and assessments.

Name: Ashish Jaiswal
Heading: Honest review
Review:
I chose this course because I was interested in cybersecurity and as a commerce student it was the only option for me to get into this field. 
Faculty behavior is nice to the students, they will always be helpful and understanding for you. the only thing you will hate is the strict 75% attendance is mandatory to give exams otherwise they won't be allowed in any situation except medical.
All the faculties are well qualified and their teaching method is advanced with the use of modern technology.
Exam difficulty is average, but if you are getting into this course as a commerce or humanities student then you'll be facing difficulty in subjects like mathematics.

Name: Lalit Kumar Singh
College: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology  - [MANIT]
Heading: A Heaven in Middle of INDIA.
Review:
From 7 semester companies visit campus so students are eligible for placements.
Google, Microsoft, Flipkart, Goldman Sachs, DB, Amazon, Maruti, Reliance, Bajaj, BPCL, etc, and the average package is approx 10 LPA (for Mechanical).
The highest is 83 LPA and the lowest is 4.5 LPA.
Approx 80% of students are placed.
Doing a Job in a good Company.

Name: aman kumar
Heading: Practical and mostly Accurate.
Review:
Placements starts from 7 th semester onwards for on campus.
Placements are good enough averaging around 5 - 6 lpa while the highest going in likes of 20+lpa, with a high chance of hike in couple of years or so. In session 2018–19 the average package was 6.08 lpa while the highest package on campus was 22lpa and off campus was 37 lpa.
Last session, around 273 students were placed with 296 job offers in various companies including Exxon Mobil, Hindalco, ZS Associates, BEL laboratories, TCS Digital, ITC, Yatra, Samsung, Global Logics, Statbeans, Berger Paints, Nerolac Paints, Asian Paints, Hero MotoCorp, Adobe, Saint Cobain, Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Adani Wilmar, Reliance Industries etc.
CSE, IT, Paint Technology and Plastic Technology are the leading branches offering upto 100% placement record.
Mechanical Engineering and Chemical technology offer some of the best packages, and they range as high as 80-90% placements. I am planning for off campus tech placements.

Name: Sachin Singh
College: J.C. Bose University Of Science And Technology, YMCA
Heading: My honest experience of J. C. Bose University (YMCA)
Review:
I choose the course (B. Sc. Life Sciences) as it was the molong with optional and additional subjects St. versatile and gave me the best options to explore a variety ovar subjects.
The course included Chemistry, Botany and Zoology that change every semester. The faculty student ratio is 2:50 average per subject. The faculty are mostly PhDs and senior teachers with great knowledge. Some of the teachers have good teaching methods but cannot say the same about others. The exams were held timely. There's sometimes issue with the spacing between two exams, where sessional exams were held very close to semester end exams.
The exam level is easy to moderate and it's very easy to pass them.

Name: Khushboo Kumari
College: Jaypee Institute of Information Technology University - [JIIT]
Heading: Life at JIIT!!
Review: The fee is quite high than government colleges but lower than some other private colleges. Details about various scholarships schemes with eligibility criteria are available on the website, changes are made periodically, therefore can't be specific about the scholarships. To my knowledge college used to provide scholarship to a student from each year with family annual income less than 2lakhs which is no longer available.

Name: PRATEEK GONDWAL
Heading: IIMC is the place to be in

A fixed schedule is shared at the beginning of the term and exams are conducted every 5 weeks to keep the learnings afloat. There are quizzes, class participation marks, and several projects which are a part of the evaluation criteria.

Name: Jatin Kumar
Heading: Shaheed Bhagat Singh Evening College: pros and cons
Review:
I have chosen this course because I am a finance enthusiast. It provides practical knowledge for real-world challenges over and above the regular B.com programme.
But if you are getting a college with good placement history with so many companies coming for placement frequently, you should opt for B.com(p) in that college.
All faculties are doctorates. Most of the faculties have good knowledge as well as impart their knowledge in the best manner.
But some of the faculties suck the blood in all the ways, such as by not having good knowledge-sharing capabilities as well as do not cooperate with internal assessments and attendance.
There are around 3000 students, and 40 faculties with each faculty having a good knowledge to teach multiple subjects.
Exams are conducted two times a year,i.e. on time in one semester.
Exams are easy to pass, you just have a basic knowledge of the concept asked and must have good handwriting.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: NIIT Review
Review:
NIIT University is a highly respected educational institution known for its commitment to preparing students for successful careers. With over 700 active industry partners, including IBM, Tata Consultancy Services, and Morgan Stanley, NU has a 100% placement record and is highly sought after by employers. This is due to the university's focus on not just academics but also career development, which prepares students for real-world challenges and helps them develop into problem solvers who are highly valued by the industry.
NU's placement process begins in the first year and includes unique workshops, the Career Development Council, and industry practice programs. The university also offers students the opportunity for summer internships and supports those who wish to start their ventures through its Centre for Innovation, Incubation, and Entrepreneurship. Additionally, NU helps students interested in further studies by mentoring them for admission to top universities in India.

Name: Epil Gagrai
Heading: ITM University Review
Review:
Like every PCB student in class 12th, I also wanted to opt for MBBS, but I couldn't clear the AIPMT exam (now known as NEET-UG) on my first try. My scores weren't great so I thought to look for other options and BSc Food Technology was something that I was fascinated with. 
There were only 17 students in my class and there were 4 faculties in our department. Some of the subjects were also taught by the faculties of other life science departments. 
Most of our faculties were usually master's and Ph.D. holders. And they were too good with their teachings.
We usually had 3 exams each semester and the exams were pretty easy to pass.

Name: rickdev hazra
Heading: Insider of NIT Calicut (pros and cons)
Review:
Environmental Geo technology is a combined course of Environmental Engineering and Geotechnical engineering. Mostly Geotech-based course.
In 2022 MTech. Batch there are 26 students and faculties are about 12 to 15.
Well-qualified teachers with highly experienced. Most teachers are actively publishing theses, articles, and projects. They are very helpful in terms of teaching as well as guidance. The teaching method is satisfactory. Mostly they do blackboard work and presentations. They bind this 2 years course full of projects, presentations, and seminars. The laboratory is also very good. And students can go and do their experiments any time. No issue with that. There will be p.hd students who will help in doing laboratory experiments.
Here one mid-term paper of 30 marks, assignments of 20 marks, and end semester of 50 marks are there. A cgpa-based system where getting passing marks is easy. The minimum required CGPA is 6.5. Below this cgpa MTech students will not get their stipend of 12,400 Rs.

Review:

The seminar hall was one of the best I've ever seen and then we were given know how about the University rules and regulations, attendance(most important aspect in GU), examination patterns, marks breakup internals externals and we were also told about societies and clubs, events that take place every year, annual fest, scholarships etc by our then Dean Dr M. Then our classes started after two days. As the place is not that happening as compared to Delhi, I still used to miss, my parents, very much and the place where I've been from.

Name: Aman singh
College: SRM Institute of Science and Technology - [SRMIST]
Heading: Overall review of SRM University
Review:
The fee structure for SRM University varies based on the program and campus. It is advisable to check the official website of the university for the latest and most accurate information.
Regarding scholarships, SRM University offers various types of scholarships to deserving students based on merit and/or financial need. Some scholarships are based on academic performance, while others are based on a combination of academic performance and need. There is also a limited number of scholarships available for international students.
For financial assistance, SRM University has tie-ups with banks and financial institutions to provide educational loans to students who need financial assistance.
The university also provides campus jobs to its students through its placement cell, the companies that visited our campus are DXC, TCS, Infosys, Capgemini, Cognizant, Tech Mahindra, and HCL. These companies hire students in bulk with an average package of 4-5 lpa.

Review: I was interested in the science and technology stuff, it always fascinated me how small things like the calculator to mobile phone work or how the application and games are built/coded so I decided that I want to do a course where I could learn all that. so I opted for BCA i.e. Bachelor in Computer Applications as the course eligibility was simple and easy. When I first attended the class, I felt that the staff was a bit short as there were 60-70 students in a class and the no. of teachers were fewer but they did cover that up within a month by dividing the class. The teacher was highly qualified in their respective fields and their teaching method was also quite flexible. The staff is polite and kind and the classrooms are spacious with screen projectors for the visual presentation of topics. Soon, the term exams for 1st semester came and the syllabus was quite easy to understand if paid attention in classes. So, passing exams was never an issue due to good teaching.

Name: Pranjal Dagar
Heading: NSUT REVIEW
Review: Life at the campus is amazing, there are places to explore where you want to be in life. The social culture of NSUT helps everyone grow into a better person. The library is full of books with helpful staff but the timings of the library are restricted which I believe can be changed. The sports culture is active enough to get engaged in it.

Name: Siddhartha Jaiswal
Heading: My jee journey ends

Name: Shivam
Heading: Nsut

Yes, btech is a little bit difficult. but if you do it properly then it is not

Name: Pavan Hegde
Heading: Brief Review of Ssu
Review: The course curriculum is industry based and ready. The curriculum is taught quite well, a faculty feedback option is also given after each month and you can choose to speak whatever you feel like. Two internals and practical and sem exams take place.

So talking about the placements it's based only on selling

Name: ASLAM ALTHAF
Heading: IIMC Internship
Review:
I chose this course to develop business acumen and the better job offers that come with the IIM brand 
Being in a classroom of 80, so far I've had 20+ professors take classes in the span of one year. So, decent ratio.
Teaching is case-based a lot of the time. Otherwise, it is lecture-based, sometimes with graded class participation
Faculty are well qualified, well spoken, mostly PhDs
Term exams are easy to pass with minimal effort

Name: Deepak Verma
Heading: NSUT Insider
Review: I am studying Computer Engineering at NSUT. The faculty in this department are pretty great and have vast knowledge in the field. They are great mentors doing research and projects. Exams in NSUT may sometime become a headache in the initial semesters as you may face tests and assignments every 2 weeks.

Name: Sarthak Kaushal
Heading: My College
Review:
Life at MDI is a blend of social, academic, and extracurricular activities. The campus has a vibrant tight-knit- community, which provides students with opportunities to make new friends, develop new skills, and engage in a variety of activities.
It has a lively social scene with a range of clubs and committees which bring students together, these are student-run clubs that anyone can join based on their interest, to develop their passion, and to be a better leader. 
The infrastructure comprises of state of art facilities with equipped resources, ventilated classrooms, lecture halls, a library, etc.

Name: PALA LAKSHMAN SAI
Heading: Good college with its own pros and cons.
Review:
I choose ECE because of its versatility, it has greater opportunities going forward.
The faculty-student ratio will be around 1:15.
Many faculties are from its and nits and some top universities around the globe and they are quite friendly and teach well.
Exams will be there every 2 months and they're a bit difficult compared to other colleges.

Name: Avinash
Heading: OUTVIEW OF SRKR
Review: The college life at SRKR is very memorable and one can collect their bag of memories at the end of the course. Here we are provided with the special programming classes for our course of study which helps the student to score well and get placed in the top company. We are provided with a central library which is big enough to gain a lot of knowledge. And also each department is provided with a departmental library. The annual fest is one of the big events of our college and our college management will celebrate that at the maximum level of their status which will be very grand. We also conduct many of the sports events on the time of the annual day and also for the general events. Here we have special Executive body member groups for each department who are responsible for all the events of the department and also they may conduct many events for the students. Overall we can enjoy ourselves a lot at this college.

Name: Ayush Anand
Heading: About your upcoming life
Review: This course is highly productive. You will never be seating like an unemployed person. I choose this course because it increases your attitude it gives you some extra knowledge about tourism and the hotel industry. If you are interested in travelling and want to job out of India then this course is very good. The qualification of staff is they do M.sc after their completing of a bachelor degree. The teaching style of the teacher is very unique and quite good. Two exams will take place in a year one is an internal exam or mid-semester exam and the other is an End semester exam. It's very easy to pass the exam you just have to give some time on your study daily.

Name: Harshit Agarwal
Heading: Life at IIM Bodh Gaya - in the lap of enlightening land
Review: The course curriculum for the first year includes subjects from all domains like IT and analytics, finance, marketing, operations, and ob/hr. The student-faculty ratio is 14:1. Faculty have good educational backgrounds with education from elite institutes of India (IIT, IIM, NIT, ICAI, etc.). Exams and extra curriculum activities can be maintained by putting in regular efforts.

Name: MD SADIQUE JAMAL
Heading: Hard working placement committee
Review: IIMBG holds an annual fest in December named elegant. It consists of sports and cultural events institutes invite celebrity singers and dj for dj night. Book is provided by the college to everyone and you can also issue books from the library. IIMBG has an online library where you can read any journal. If any document is not available you can ask the librarian he will get that. IIMBG has 3 main sports leagues cricket, football and basketball. the college has 7-8 committees and 15-20 clubs.

Name: Pranab Sritam Sahu
Heading: Not too good or too bad ! 50/50

Name: Ankit Kumar Anoop

Name: sairam itha
Heading: CMR University
Review:
Culture fests and founder day in November month.  Fresh introduction day and all important days and fests are conducted. and plenty of books are available in the library for exams and placement training. the amenities provided in the classroom are a projector and a mic.
NCC will provide cricket tournaments. Tech tub, infinity club, and the alpha club are run by students.

Name: Aryan Kede
Heading: My experience at DAC College Chandigarh till now
Review:
Our college fest was just held recently and conducted in winter mostly but it was boring for the people who were not part of any event or program. But our college does provide different activities and sports and games on campus. The campus life is very colorful and cheering and the campus is ragging free as far as visible. Our college provides a basketball court, badminton hall, football ground and even a shooting range which is paid for. The campus is best known for its cricket coaching and it is best if you want to have a career in cricket. Big cricket stars like Sachin Tendulkar's son come to play cricket at our college sometimes. Many big Olympic stars like Neeraj Chopra or big cricket star Kapil Dev were pass-outs from DAV college Chandigarh. 
Classrooms are spacious and comfortable and a good studying environment is offered.
Different clubs like Raah the Library Club, PSA Political Club and Reading Club, etc. are made to connect with every student with different interests.

College: Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology - [MIET]
Heading: Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology overall review
Review: The social life at miet is quite good. There are lots of fests that occur at the campus the main annual fest is kolahal which occurs in the month of October or November it is a 3-day fest. There are various other fests including tech fest and others. There are approximately 3 to 4 libraries on campus that provide a wide range of books for every subject including journals. The college also promotes sports and extracurricular activities. The college selected player's through trials every year for various sports and they get a chance to play in inter-college tournaments and the yearly AKTU sports fest. There are various social groups and clubs also like the robotics club satellite club and many more interesting ones furthermore there is an innovation cell in the college where a student can share his or her idea and the members help him or her with that.
